page.title: 18GUN DOG TRAINING - ABLINGTON
page.content: The old works pumphouse for Ablington Airfield was converted to Kennels in 1977 with a total capacity for 32 dogs. The building is approx. 7 yd.by 11 yd. and is made of cement rendered brick with an asbestos roof. The dogs sleep on wooden benches above the sawdust covered concrete floors. Outside there is a large run, 45 yd. by 20 yd. Shooting dogs , i.e. Labradors, Retrievers and Spaniels are trained for obedience, and the actual gun training consisting of hunting, retrieving, whistle control and response to directional hand signals can take up to 6 months. Most of the work is done single-handed by the owner who also breeds Labradors, golden Retrievers, English Springers and Cocker Spaniels.
